Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant with water and show that it is healthy and growing.
The student can illustrate a plant without water and show that it is not healthy or not growing.
The student can draw and label the sunlight to show that plants also need light to live and grow.
The student can identify and illustrate changes they observe in plants when water is added or taken away using clear visual patterns.
The student can create a drawing that shows the difference between a well-watered plant and a plant that is not watered.
